snippet: Hillary Clinton and others are asking whether there’s a need for greater regulation of stock buybacks, on which companies have spent $7 trillion since 2004.
abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin Dealbook column observes that stock buybacks are drawing scrutiny from politicians, including Democratic presidential hopeful Hillary Rodham Clinton, who says practice needs tighter regulation; argues that while goal is worthy one, it is hard to influence when and how a company chooses to invest in operations and new jobs
lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton and others are asking whether there’s a need for greater regulation of stock buybacks, on which companies have spent $7 trillion since 2004.

headline.print_headline: Stock Buybacks Draw Scrutiny From Politicians
headline.main: Stock Buybacks Draw Scrutiny From Politicians
